definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: Did ever dragon keep so far a cave?
sentences.chinese: 哪一條惡龍曾經棲息在這清雅的洞府裏？

sentences.english: Did ever dragon deep so fair a cave?
sentences.chinese: 哪一條惡龍曾經住在這樣清雅的洞府？

sentences.english: The fox preys farthest from his hole.
Look at this happy village in the heavenly palace of the cave world.
sentences.chinese: 再請看這是洞府天宮中的歡樂村。

definition: underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
to shed skin/to leave one's mortal envelope/remains (of a priest)
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
forbidden area/restricted area/(fig.) sth considered off-limits
lit. devils' castle/place occupied by sinister forces
